body.p:
To his Excellency the Hon B Magoffin
Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your Petitioner Joshua P Owens would represent to your Exclency ^Excellency^ that on the 30th day of May 1860 one Richard Lock was arrested in Adair County on a charge of Grand Larceny and was required to give bail in the Sum of Three hundred Dollars, Your petitioner and one A B Preston & J M Cataline became licensed as the Security of Said Lock for his appearance at the Novr Term 1860 if the Adair Circuit Court Said Lock. Preston & Cataline had all left the state of Ky before Said Term of the circuit and some of them are now in the Army, at said Novr Term of Said Court Said Bail Bond was forfeited, and Sums ordered against the Said Lock & securities your petitioner did not know until this was done that said Lock Cataline and Preston had left the State, Your petitioner States that there was not proof Sufficient to convict Said Lock and he would have been acquited if he had appeared Your petition is not able to pay Said bond without great last sacrifice, he therefore prays that your excellency may remit said Bail bond as it will ^may^ save your petitioner from Bankruptcy

We the undersigned citizens of Adair County concur in the foregoing Statements, and we feel that it is a case in which ^the^ Executive Should grant the request of the petitioner we therefore ac ask that the petitioner be released for from the payment of said bail or any part thereof
